meanings.definition: A small, exclusive group of people.
meanings.sent1: In school, the popular kids formed a clique that no one else could join.
meanings.sent2: The clique of friends always sat together at lunch.
meanings.sent3: The clique of book lovers only read mystery novels together.
meanings.sent4: The clique of artists painted the town with their creativity.
meanings.sent5: The clique of hikers explored the trails every weekend.

meanings.sent1: She tried to clique with the new students to make friends.
meanings.sent2: They decided to clique together to feel more comfortable in the new environment.
meanings.sent3: He cliqued with the gamers to join their team for the tournament.
meanings.sent4: The employees cliqued to discuss their concerns about the new policy.
meanings.sent5: The students cliqued to organize a surprise party for their teacher.
